feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It divides the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month to determine the daily rate. The calculator accounts for leave policy type (calendar days or working days) and automatically deducts public holidays from working day counts. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system generates an automatic pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. This ensures accurate salary reduction based on the specific leave period and applicable business rules.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of applicable salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment.

Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, deduction reflected on the payroll table
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve leave request, determine leave policy type (calendar or working days), calculate total working days in month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary by actual working days, generate automatic payroll deduction

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), choose salary components to factor into calculations, and apply the configuration.

1. Access Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service encashment eligibility.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated transactions, reject those transactions and resave the new proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. Leave policy can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month are deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days used in calculation

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in month: 31 for January, 28 for February), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA compliance with labor law). Only Superadmin, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select the calculation base.

Salary component selection limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection limited to three options: Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Super admins can configure which specific leave types are eligible for encashment.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated daily and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the working day count when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working policy, daily pay is calculated based on 20 days, not 22 days

Calculation results vary depending on month length when using calendar days, and different calculation methods (calendar days vs. working days vs. custom days) can significantly impact final wage calculations. Companies must ensure their chosen method aligns with applicable labor law requirements.
Super admins can see which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten when applying new leave encashment configurations.
Multiple options are available for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on payroll policy requirements

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist for one or multiple employees, Super admin must manually reject those transactions and then save the new salary proration changes to ensure consistency.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; integrates with leave management system to receive approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems for salary information

The Daily Wage Calculator impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings to determine which days are counted in wage calculations.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service benefit calculations.
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts first salary calculations and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days: A leave policy based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days per month). Working days: A leave policy based on working days (e.g., 22 working days per month)

Calendar days: The total number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: Only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: Flexible calculation base set by payroll managers according to company policies, commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA labor law compliance.

Leave encashment: The conversion of accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits upon termination or separation. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation, with deductions calculated daily based on configured rates. Daily rate calculation: The method used to compute deductions per day (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances, Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). Leave encashment: Similar feature for calculating leave payouts.

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: Method of calculating proportional salary based on days worked. Calculation bases: custom days, calendar days, or working days—the three options for determining proration method.
